SubTopics: Understand a fraction 1/b as the quantity formed by 1 part when a whole is partitioned into b equal parts; understand a fraction a/b as the quantity formed by a parts of size 1/b.
Content: Theo divided a garden equally into 6 parts. He planted seeds in 5 of the parts. In what fraction of the garden did Theo plant seeds?

SubTopics: Determine the unknown whole number in a multiplication or division equation relating three whole numbers.
Content: What number makes the equation below true?

SubTopics: Draw a scaled picture graph and a scaled bar graph to represent a data set with several categories. Solve one- and two-step “how many more” and “how many less” problems using information presented in scaled bar graphs.
Content: The bar graph shows the numbers and colors of cars in a parking lot.
problems/NY17G3M/media/5a.jpg
The total number of silver and black cars equals the total number of red, white, and blue cars. How many black cars are in the parking lot?

SubTopics: Solve two-step word problems using the four operations. Represent these problems using equations with a letter standing for the unknown quantity. Assess the reasonableness of answers using mental computation and estimation strategies including rounding.
Content: Colton and his dad bought a gallon of paint that cost $13. They also bought 2 brushes that cost $9 each. What was the total cost, not including tax, of the brushes and the paint they bought?

SubTopics: Use place value understanding to round whole numbers to the nearest 10 or 100.
Content: The table below shows four numbers rounded to the nearest hundreds place. One of the numbers is rounded incorrectly.
problems/NY17G3M/media/7a.jpg
Which number is rounded to the nearest hundreds place incorrectly?

SubTopics: Interpret whole-number quotients of whole numbers, e.g., interpret 56 ÷ 8 as the number of objects in each share when 56 objects are partitioned equally into 8 shares, or as a number of shares when 56 objects are partitioned into equal shares of 8 objects each.
Content: Tayshawn sorts 56 marbles into equal groups with no marbles left over. Which statement could be true of the groups of marbles Tayshawn sorts?

A.Choice: There are 6 groups of marbles with 8 marbles in each group.

B.Choice: There are 7 groups of marbles with 7 marbles in each group.

C.Choice: There are 8 groups of marbles with 7 marbles in each group.

D.Choice: There are 9 groups of marbles with 6 marbles in each group.

SubTopics: Represent a fraction a/b on a number line diagram by marking off a lengths 1/b from 0. Recognize that the resulting interval has size a/b and that its endpoint locates the number a/b on the number line.
Content: Erin walked 1 mile from her house to the library. Along the way, she passed several places shown on the number line below.
problems/NY17G3M/media/9a.jpg
Which place is 4/8 mile from Erin’s house?

SubTopics: Draw a scaled picture graph and a scaled bar graph to represent a data set with several categories. Solve one- and two-step “how many more” and “how many less” problems using information presented in scaled bar graphs.
Content: The graph below shows the number of shirts of each color in a store.
problems/NY17G3M/media/13a.jpg
How many more red shirts than the total number of blue shirts and yellow shirts are in the store?

SubTopics: Understand a fraction 1/b as the quantity formed by 1 part when a whole is partitioned into b equal parts; understand a fraction a/b as the quantity formed by a parts of size 1/b.
Content: Which of these is shaded to represent 2/3?

SubTopics: Solve two-step word problems using the four operations. Represent these problems using equations with a letter standing for the unknown quantity. Assess the reasonableness of answers using mental computation and estimation strategies including rounding.
Content: Carmen saved 592 pennies. Her sister saved 128 pennies. Together, they put 250 pennies in wrappers and took them to the bank. What is the total number of pennies, rounded to the nearest hundred, Carmen and her sister have left?

SubTopics: Represent a fraction 1/b on a number line diagram by defining the interval from 0 to 1 as the whole and partitioning it into b equal parts. Recognize that each part has size 1/b and that the endpoint of the part based at 0 locates the number 1/b on the number line.
Content: Which fraction does point P represent on the number line below?
problems/NY17G3M/media/20a.jpg

SubTopics: Understand division as an unknown-factor problem.
Content: Anya placed 16 cups in rows on a table. There are 8 cups in each row. Which equation could be used to represent this situation?

SubTopics: Understand two fractions as equivalent (equal) if they are the same size, or the same point on a number line.
Content: Which fraction is equal to 2/8?

SubTopics: A plane figure which can be covered without gaps or overlaps by n unit squares is said to have an area of n square units.
Content: Brandon used square tiles to find the area of the shaded part of the picture below.
problems/NY17G3M/media/23a.jpg
What is the area of the shaded part of the picture?

SubTopics: Determine the unknown whole number in a multiplication or division equation relating three whole numbers.
Content: Which pair of equations is true when the number 8 is placed in the blanks?

SubTopics: Understand a fraction 1/b as the quantity formed by 1 part when a whole is partitioned into b equal parts; understand a fraction a/b as the quantity formed by a parts of size 1/b.
Content: The figure below is divided into equal sized parts,
problems/NY17G3M/media/25a.jpg
Which fraction is represented by the shaded parts of the figure?

SubTopics: Interpret whole-number quotients of whole numbers, e.g., interpret 56 ÷ 8 as the number of objects in each share when 56 objects are partitioned equally into 8 shares, or as a number of shares when 56 objects are partitioned into equal shares of 8 objects each.
Content: There are 12 students in Ms. Miller's class. She needs 24 juice boxes for a class party. The juice boxes come in packages of 6 juice boxes each. Which expression represents the number of packages of juice boxes Ms. Miller needs to buy for the class party?

SubTopics: Find the area of a rectangle with whole-number side lengths by tiling it, and show that the area is the same as would be found by multiplying the side lengths.
Content: The figure below is tiled with squares.
problems/NY17G3M/media/27a.jpg
Which expression could be used to find the area of this figure?

SubTopics: Apply properties of operations - inlcuding the commutative property of multiplication, associative property of multiplication, and distributive property - as strategies to multiply and divide.
Content: Which expression is equivalent to 5 × 9?

SubTopics: Use place value understanding to round whole numbers to the nearest 10 or 100.
Content: A coach rounded the number of runners at a track meet to the nearest 10. The rounded number of runners is 400. Which number could be the actual number of runners at the track meet?

SubTopics: Solve two-step word problems using the four operations. Represent these problems using equations with a letter standing for the unknown quantity. Assess the reasonableness of answers using mental computation and estimation strategies including rounding.
Content: Last weekend Sanjay watched 3 television shows that were each 30 minutes long. He also watched 1 movie on television that was 90 minutes long. What is the total number of minutes Sanjay watched television last weekend?

SubTopics: Use multiplication and division within 100 to solve word problems in situations involving equal groups, arrays, and measurement quantities, e.g., by using drawings and equations with a symbol for the unknown number to represent the problem.
Content: A total of 30 players will play basketball at a park. There will be exactly 5 players on each team. Which statement correctly explains how to find the number of teams needed?

SubTopics: Tell and write time to the nearest minute and measure time intervals in minutes. Solve word problems involving addition and subtraction of time intervals in minutes, e.g., by representing the problem on a number line diagram.
Content: Frankie's music class begins at 9:40 a.m. The class is 45 minutes long. Which clock shows the time that Frankie's class ends?

SubTopics: Understand division as an unknown-factor problem.
Content: What number multiplied by 4 equals 36?

SubTopics: Recognize and generate simple equivalent fractions, e.g., 1/2 = 2/4, 4/6 = 2/3. Explain why the fractions are equivalent, e.g., by using a visual fraction model.
Content: The fraction strip shown below is shaded to represent a fraction.
problems/NY17G3M/media/37a.jpg
Which fraction strip is shaded to represent a fraction equal to the fraction strip shown above?

SubTopics: Compare two fractions with the same numerator or the same denominator by reasoning about their size. Recognize that comparisons are valid only when the two fractions refer to the same whole. Record the results of comparisons with the symbols >, =, or <, and justify the conclusions, e.g., by using a visual fraction model.
Content: Which fraction comparison is not correct?

SubTopics: Multiply side lengths to find areas of rectangles with whole-number side lengths in the context of solving real world and mathematical problems, and represent whole-number products as rectangular areas in mathematical reasoning.
Content: Kelly has a rectangular poster in her room. The poster is shown below.
problems/NY17G3M/media/39a.jpg
What is the area, in square feet, of Kelly's poster?

SubTopics: Use multiplication and division within 100 to solve word problems in situations involving equal groups, arrays, and measurement quantities, e.g., by using drawings and equations with a symbol for the unknown number to represent the problem.
Content: Ms. Perez drove a total of 40 miles in 5 days. She drove the same number of miles each day. How many miles did Ms. Perez drive each day?

SubTopics: Represent a fraction a/b on a number line diagram by marking off a lengths 1/b from 0. Recognize that the resulting interval has size a/b and that its endpoint locates the number a/b on the number line.
Content: Four different recipes were used by students to bake cookies for a bake sale. The number line below shows the fraction of a cup of milk needed in each recipe.
problems/NY17G3M/media/41a.jpg
Which recipe needs 3/8 cup of milk?

SubTopics: Measure areas by counting unit squares (square cm, square m, square in, square ft, and improvised units).
Content: The diagram below represents a wall Kim painted in her basement.
problems/NY17G3M/media/43a.jpg
What is the area, in square feet, of the wall Kim painted?

SubTopics: Solve two-step word problems using the four operations. Represent these problems using equations with a letter standing for the unknown quantity. Assess the reasonableness of answers using mental computation and estimation strategies including rounding.
Content: Conor made 9 shapes with straws. Each shape had 5 straws. Conor used 15 more straws to make more shapes. What is the total number of straws Conor used to make all the shapes?
